title: Greek lessons for Beginners | Greek basic words you Must know before traveling | Do you Speak Greek?
content: Are you traveling in Greece this summer? Let’s go to teach you some basics My name is Alexandra , I’m Greek , I live in Thessaloniki, Greece and I’m a Greek teacher. In this channel  I show you the real Greek language and I teach you through real activities. If you travel in Greece or if you live in Greece , subscribe and let’s get started. When I travel to a different country I like to learn 3 words : good morning, hello and thank you. I believe ‘’good morning’’ is a very  important word to know . Because it’s the first word we say and listen to in the morning. You can say that everywhere. To your neighbor , to a store, to the bakery shop. So in Greek it is Kaleemera. And we say kaleemera  usually until 1 or 2 pm. Hello in Greek is Yia ! Yia su! If you want to be more personal. Or Yia sas when you talk to many people or you want to be polite. You can say Yia any time during the day and night. And of course thank you is efharisto . I like to say efharisto in a restaurant, in a coffee shop . in a store. Everywhere . To show my appreciation to people. We talked about morning greetings, but what about afternoon? You can say Κalispera which means good afternoon or later is used like good evening . After 8 pm  you can say Κalo vrathi good evening And of course at night you can say Κalinihta. In Greek the word ‘’please ‘’ and ‘’your welcome’’ is the same . You can say parakalo when somebody just told you efharisto( thank you) Or you can say parakalo , if you want to ask for something Tha ithela ena neraki, parakalo! I would like some water , please! Tha ithela is another great way to ask something politely. It means I would like to. Do you want to agree or disagree with somebody? Just say ne yes  or ohi no! Another great word you need to know before traveling is Sighnomi. Sighomi can mean I’m sorry or excuse me Let’s say you want to buy some souvenirs for your loved ones and you would like to ask for the price. You can say : Poso kani; (How much is it?) For example : Poso kani afto to forema ; How much is this dress? And now let’s go to communication . How do you say that you don’t understand Greek and you want to make it clear? You can say Then katalaveno I don’t understand. Or then milao elinika I don’t speak greek And of course you can ask them back : Μilate anglika; Do you speak english? Another favorite word of Greeks is to say ‘’cheers’’ when they drink alcohol . So they raise their glasses and say ‘’yia mas! But be careful : don’t do that with water or coffee! Another word you should know if you want to enjoy Greek music or dance is Opa! Actually it doesn’t mean something specific but we use it as an exclamation of enthusiasm or joy! I hope you never need to use this word but it’s good to know It's the word for help and in Greek it is  Voithia!!! And last but not least is a beautiful phrase you should know if you love Greece and I think you do And it is aghapao tin elatha ! I love Greece! If you want to learn more Greek , please subscribe to my channel and check out the videos I left in the description box. Also write in the comments where and when you are  going to travel this summer?. I hope to see you in another video. See you soon! Filakia (kisses)!!!
